summary: REQ-22 appears implemented by updating CSS variables in frontend/src/index.css with a Chaniya Choli-inspired palette for both light and dark modes. REQ-23 is partially implemented in ColorPlaceholdersSection by keeping placeholder text neutral, but other placeholder text areas (e.g., header/mobile logo photo box label) are not shown as updated. The diff also adds an unrequested notes input feature to the color placeholders section, which violates the non-goal of not changing content beyond what’s needed for colors/placeholder text behavior.

missing_requirements.requirement: Remove colored text styling from all photo/placeholder areas across the site so that any text shown inside photo placeholders stays neutral (foreground/muted) and does not switch to an accent/primary color on hover or interaction.
missing_requirements.reason: Only ColorPlaceholdersSection was modified. The BuildRequest explicitly calls out other placeholder areas (e.g., header/mobile logo photo box label), but no diff evidence shows those components were updated to remove accent/primary or hover-to-primary text color changes.
evidence: No changes shown for header/mobile placeholder components (e.g., frontend/src/components/marketing/HeaderNav.tsx is not modified in diff)

hallucinated_features.description: Added per-tile notes functionality (React state, change handler, and an Input field under each color placeholder tile).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly limits changes to updating the global palette and removing colored/hover-colored text inside photo placeholders; it also states not to change existing content/copy beyond what’s required. Adding note inputs is new UI/content and not requested by REQ-22/REQ-23.
evidence: frontend/src/components/marketing/sections/ColorPlaceholdersSection.tsx (useState notes, handleNoteChange, and <Input ... placeholder="Add notes..." /> added)
